task_summary: Drive down a bright corridor and reach the named waypoint 'goal', confirming arrival and briefly stabilizing afterward.

task_long_description.overview: The frames depict a well-lit hallway with a white curved wall, dark floor, and doorway trim, indicating forward motion along a corridor toward a destination. The behavior focuses on minimal, reliable goal-seeking: verify whether the robot is already at the goal, otherwise command navigation to the named location with a neutral yaw. After arrival, a short wait helps stabilize pose estimates and sensors before task termination in this feature-sparse, reflective environment.
preconditions: Map/topology where 'goal' is resolvable as a location_id
Navigation stack running with obstacle avoidance
Sensors operating in indoor lighting conditions
stepwise_plan: Evaluate IsAt('goal') to check if already at destination.
If not, NavigateToNamed to 'goal' with yaw 0 and bounded timeout.
Upon success, Wait briefly to stabilize and confirm steady state.
success_criteria: IsAt('goal') true at the end of execution
Robot remains stationary during the stabilization wait
failure_and_recovery: If NavigateToNamed fails or times out, the Fallback re-evaluates and can re-attempt navigation on subsequent ticks leveraging navigator recovery behaviors
Short wait mitigates minor localization jitter near glossy walls
task_long_description.termination: Sequence ends after confirming goal condition and completing the stabilization wait

frame_3.now_evidence: centered corridor alignment and reduced perspective change indicate nearing a stable pose consistent with arrival verification
frame_3.predicts_next: continued approach followed by IsAt evaluation and stabilization wait

node_specs.description: Check whether robot is already at the named goal
Navigate to a named location with neutral yaw and a bounded timeout

failure_modes: Localization drift near feature-poor wall prevents IsAt from triggering
recovery_strategy: Allow re-ticks through Fallback to reissue NavigateToNamed after transient failure
Rely on navigator internal recovery (replan, clear costmaps) and stabilization wait
assumptions: Frames show forward corridor motion without explicit goal signage; 'goal' is a symbolic map waypoint resolved by the navigation stack

expected_success_criteria: Final IsAt('goal') true and successful NavigateToNamed within 3000 ms plus completed 500 ms wait
